issue.title: Assign a fixed node to a preauthkey connection attempt
issue.body:
I have an automated service that I want to use headscale with. This service is running as an ephemeral container and fails to safe runtime information. However, I want this service to always appear the same node, when it restarts.
How can I make it that the preauthkey for the service ends up creating/assigning to the same node with the same internal IP and hostname?

forkee.name: headscale
forkee.description: An open source, self-hosted implementation of the Tailscale control server

issue.title: Machine namespace not changed after logout and reauth
issue.body:
**Bug description**

The machine namespace/ip/nodekey won't change after logout+reauth. I think that is probably a security issue.

**To Reproduce**

Register a machine with tailscale up and user1, then logout and reregister with a different user2. The machine will be logged in with the namespace of user1.

**Context info**
- Headscale commit be25bbce92fb1be3c233ad286971bd738923c352
- Tailscale 1.22.2
- OS: Linux
- Kernel: 5.15.19

comment.body: This issue was closed because it has been inactive for 14 days since being marked as stale.

issue.title: Preauth keys for different users
issue.body:
<!-- Headscale is a multinational community across the globe. Our common language is English. Please consider raising the bug report in this language. -->

**Bug description**
I have two preauth keys A and B, and a new client. I first use A to join headscale and this client successfully joins user A. After that I use B on the client and the client does not switch to user B, it is still on A. Is this correct?

comment.body: This issue is stale because it has been open for 180 days with no activity.

issue.title: Homebrew formula for macOS CLI releases
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Would it be possible to add a [homebrew formula](https://docs.brew.sh/Formula-Cookbook) to make installing the CLI on macOS (or Linux through [LinuxBrew](https://docs.brew.sh/Homebrew-on-Linux) maybe) more convenient?
